review: So worth the line ups..Definitely worth trying while in downtown Toronto ..$10 for a whole cake...❤️

Finally stumbled upon this place that has so much hype. We bought the ten dollar cheesecake but while it was light and fluffy, we thought that it was basically tasteless egg whites. We wouldn't purchase it again.

Semisweet plain cheesecake
Never tried this before
Very soft and fresh
Would love to try cheesecake tarts next time

Only recently have I been to Uncle Tetsu's as usually the lines to get a cheesecake were way too ridiculous. However, by a stroke of some luck I have been able to really enjoy their delicious cheesecakes and honey Madeline's. I believe the packaging, even...

Finally had the chance to swing by this place. Yes, I know... I'm VERY behind in the trends. But being someone who is not a huge fan of desserts to begin with, it wasn't high on my priorities list.
Unfortunately, I'm just not sure what...

It used to be super busy but now it has died down. I always get the regular cheesecake $10. Now there are two locations downtown and one in Pacific mall. So it is easier accessible. So fluffy highly recommend! Definitely worth the money vs Pablo.

I was advised that a visit to Uncle Tetsu’s was a must for a cheesecake lover, but that I needed to be ready to wait in line for a long time. Well my timing must have been perfect because there was no line at all!...

Located next to the Bus Terminal in downtown Toronto, it is very common to see Bus passengers carrying Uncle Tetsu bags. Line ups are very common as the store is very small. That being said, the cheesecake (which is $10) is light, fluffy, and delicious....

Yes, you have to wait in line for a cheesecake, but it is SO worth it. The light delicate flavor of the Japanese cheesecake is worth $10. After I waited in line for 10 minutes, I went into the adjacent space for cheese tarts. OMG...

Have wanted to here ever since I saw a line up around block on a visit to Toronto a couple of years ago and hearing about their soufflé-like cheesecakes. We happened to pass by when the line was just a few people out the door....
